title: Consumer Spending Rose as Omicron Wave Ebbed, Economists Say
sub_head: Inflation seen as staying elevated amid rising energy and commodities prices
body:
Americans boosted their spending at a cooler pace last month, as the Omicron surge of Covid-19 eased, but inflation remained high amid Russiaâ€™s invasion of Ukraine, economists estimated.
Economists surveyed by The Wall Street Journal expect the Commerce Department to report Thursday that consumer spending rose at a seasonally adjusted 0.5% in February from the month before, down from 2.1% in January. The department is also set to release fresh data on personal income and inflation.
